content:
Diagnosis
	1. P16 positive oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma T4N2M1
	Initially diagnosed March 2023
	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None indicated

	Radiotherapy
	May 2023 - Radical chemoradiotherapy 70Gy in 35 fractions with concurrent cisplatin

	Chemotherapy
	1. Concurrent cisplatin with radiotherapy May-June 2023
	2. Palliative nivolumab commenced September 2023
	3. Second-line chemotherapy with weekly paclitaxel from January 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new pulmonary metastases

	Current issues
	1. Progressive dysphagia requiring nasogastric feeding
	2. Increasing pain from pulmonary metastases
	3. Deteriorating performance status

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today following recent CT showing disease progression with new pulmonary metastases despite second-line weekly paclitaxel. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. Patient experiencing increasing dysphagia requiring nasogastric feeding and escalating pain from pulmonary disease. Recent admission for pneumonia now resolved with antibiotics.

Discussion held with patient and family regarding poor prognosis. Agreement to transition to best supportive care with focus on symptom management.

	Further investigations
	None indicated

	Medication prescribed
	1. Oxycodone MR 40mg BD increased from 20mg BD
	2. Dexamethasone 4mg OD

	Follow up
	Referral made to community palliative care team
	Urgent outpatient review arranged with palliative care physician

	Required GP actions
	Please support referral to community palliative care team
	Prescribe breakthrough analgesia as required

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed disease progression and poor prognosis
	Explained rationale for transition to palliative care
	Provided contact details for acute oncology service
